title: Antimagic

The **antimagic** effect and weapon [brand](/Brand "Brand") interferes with the [spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") of anything it affects.

## Contents

- [1 Effect](#Effect)

  - [1.1 Against monsters](#Against_monsters)
  - [1.2 Against players](#Against_players)
  - [1.3 Wielding](#Wielding)

- [2 Sources](#Sources)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 References](#References)

## Effect

### Against monsters

Antimagic is a status that interferes with casting. When using a "Magical" or "Wizard" [ability](/Spell_slot_flag "Spell slot flag"), monsters have a `duration/(4 + duration)` (in [decaAut](/DecaAut "DecaAut")) chance to fail, wasting their turn.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Even [silence](/Silence "Silence")-proof enemies like [demons](/Demon "Demon") and [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire") can be affected by antimagic, but "Priestly" (e.g. [spriggan berserker](/Spriggan_berserker "Spriggan berserker")) or "Natural" (e.g. [dragon](/Dragon "Dragon") breath) abilities aren't affected.

Weapons of antimagic inflict `damage×8/(HD+1)` turns of the antimagic status.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

### Against players

Antimagic directly reduces your current MP. Every time a monster attacks you with an antimagic branded weapon, it drains a random amount of MP up to the damage dealt, but weighted toward half that amount.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Player [Djinn](/Djinn "Djinn") are immune to this effect, as they don't have proper MP.

### Wielding

Players that wield a weapon of antimagic will have their maximum MP reduced by 2/3. A character who has already exhausted their MP pool is free to switch to it mid-combat, though this will lower your MP regeneration (as it is based off max MP).

## Sources

Antimagic is a fairly rare status and brand. The brand is unable to be obtained via a [scroll of brand weapon](/Scroll_of_brand_weapon "Scroll of brand weapon").

- The antimagic brand is [Trog](/Trog "Trog")'s special brand, so gifted weapons may have it.
- The [Enfeeble](/Enfeeble "Enfeeble") spell will always inflict the antimagic status, regardless of resistance or EV.
- [Vine Stalkers](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") possess a unique antimagic [bite attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack").
- [Black Mark](/Black_Mark "Black Mark") may inflict antimagic if it would have an effect on the target.
- [Ru](/Ru "Ru")'s Apocalypse may cause antimagic (25%) on any target it would have an effect on.

**Monster-only spells**

- [Drain Magic](/Drain_Magic "Drain Magic") and [Draining Gaze](/Draining_Gaze "Draining Gaze") directly inflict antimagic, using [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power") to determine MP drain.
- [Sap Magic](/Sap_Magic "Sap Magic") inflicts antimagic when used against other monsters (players hit by Sap Magic gain an analogous, but distinct effect).

## Strategy

Though it deals no extra damage, antimagic weapons are extremely useful against magical opponents. A well-enchanted weapon in the hands of a capable fighter will be able to cause most of an enemy's spells to fail, which amounts to semi-[paralysis](/Paralysis "Paralysis"). As such, antimagic weapons can reduce the threat posed by powerful end-game opponents such as the lords of [Hell](/Hell "Hell") or [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire") dramatically; you just have to get into melee range with the enemy first.

Antimagic

From CrawlWiki
